meanings.definition: Having sharp, uneven edges or points.
meanings.sent1: The jaggedest rocks can be dangerous to climb.
meanings.sent2: The mountain range was filled with jaggedest peaks.
meanings.sent3: The jaggedest piece of paper tore right through the envelope.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a jaggedest edge when she spoke about her past.
meanings.sent5: The jaggedest glass shards glittered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of jagged, meaning the most jagged.
meanings.sent1: He won the award for creating the jaggedest sculpture in the exhibit.
meanings.sent2: The jaggedest of the cliffs overlooked the crashing waves below.
meanings.sent3: The jaggedest in the group always stood out with their unique style.
meanings.sent4: His wit was the jaggedest, cutting through any pretense with ease.
meanings.sent5: The jaggedest of memories can sometimes be the most vivid.
